page.title: 02THE AXE VALLY
page.content:
{The Axe Valley. The Axe valley runs north south through the most eastern part of county Devon. The valley is typically broad with a very clear flood plain. The river floods this area each year around spring. As a result the valley floor is dominated by pastrol farming. Most fo the farmsteads and the roads in the valley avoid flooding by being located on the valley sides. The sides of the valley are flanked by Greensand hills which rise to nearly 500 metres at Trinity hill. The sandstone ridge to the east is capped by clay with flints and this supports a Heath like vegetation,or
planted conifers. The valley sides are devoted to high quality pasture and ley grass.Asimular pattern exists to the west of the valley
